archimate:ApplicationComponent.name: Reference Data Management Centre [RDMC]
archimate:ApplicationComponent.documentation:
Reference data is extracted from MDM and passed to RDMC which creates the specific reference data files required by Horizon
RDMC is the primary repository for reference data within the HNG-X System. This reference data is received from a number of sources: • Type A Reference Data is delivered by the POL MDM system. The interface is described in BP/IFS/010 • Type B reference data is prepared by the Fujitsu Services reference data team within Customer Services in response to reference data changes requests from POL. The interface is described in RD/IFS/023. • Type C reference data is legacy Horizon reference data. It continues to be used to support APOP Host reference data for HNG-X. The interface is described in RD/IFS/022 • HNG-X specific reference data in XML format (this document) is the set of additional reference data which is required to support the HNG-X solution but is not included in the Type A, B or C interfaces. This reference data is referred to as Type X. This reference data includes: 1. Postal Services reference data 2. Transaction Scripts reference data 3. Menu Definition reference data 4. Pin Pad reference data 5. Miscellaneous other reference data Type X reference data is delivered as a set of XML records in files which are in XML document format. • HNG-X specific reference data files (this document) is the set of non-XML deliverables which is required to support the HNG-X solution. This reference data is referred to as Type F. Delivery of Type F reference data requires delivery of the actual Type F file containing the non-XML deliverable, e.g. a logo bitmap, and an information file in XML format containing processing details about the Type F file. • HNG-X specific XSDs. These define the XSDs for object types which are delivered as Type X reference data. XSDs are used in RDMC for validation purposes only and the data is not distributed elsewhere within the HNG-X domain. Delivery of an XSD requires delivery of the actual XSD in one file and delivery of an information file in XML format containing details of the XSD file.
